title: Thunderbird oAuth2 connection to Azure AD app
content:
Dear support,

I am an Azure AD admin and recently we have been receiving ticket that some users cannot connect with they Thunderbird clients to our Exchange Online mailboxes.

Because MS turn off the basic authentication I had to created/register an Azure app with the normal API permissions for POP,IMAP,offline_access and SMTP. After that in 2023 January I also had to delete and register again the app because of a major change.

Everything fine until now, where I did try it also out and the account is not connecting to the exchange online server.

I followed you article precisely and did all the steps but no success: https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/kb/microsoft-oauth-authentication-and-thunderbird-202

1 - Delete the app and re-registered via the Link and as admin I have granted it to the entire company 2 - I did make a clean install of Thunderbird and deleted all profiles and created a new one. 

     Also via Config Editor removed all 4 entries with *auth2.scope at the end.

I've spent 5 hours trying to make it work.

Is the connection to M365 still supported ?

best regards, Mihai

title: Can the calendar "event dots" in Supernova be removed without CSS?
content:
In Supernova (i.e. Thunderbird 115 and above), the mini-month calendar shows a little blue dot under every day that has an event on it. See the example screenshot.

If you're like me and you have an event almost every day, then these dots don't really provide any informational content â they're just visual clutter.

There is a way to remove them, using userChrome.css: 

   .minimonth-day::after {        display: none !important;    }


But obviously that's not so good for users who aren't adept in CSS. Is there a way to remove the dots through a preference, or something in about:config?

title: How to apply column settings to all my RSS feed folders in v115?
content:
I've just updated Thunderbird to v115, and have been setting up my folder views as I'd like them.

In one of my RSS feed folders, I set up a column layout. I'd like to use this for all my RSS feeds, so I do the following:

  • From the dropdown at the right hand side of the column headings, choose "Apply columns to..." > "Folder and its children..." > "RSS" > "RSS"
  • In the confirmation box that appears, click "OK"

There's no indication of any error or warning, but the operation silently fails. That is: when I look at any of the other RSS feed folders (which are descendants of "RSS" in the tree view), none of them have had my desired column layout applied to them.

Am I doing something wrong in the UI, or is this a bug?

(Note: this functionality *does* work for non-RSS folders. For example, if I do the above procedure, except for "Local Folders" instead of "RSS", then the column settings are correctly applied to every folder that is a descendant of "Local Folders". So the issue seems to be specific to feeds as opposed to mail.)

title: Thunderbird attachments problem.
content:
Hi,

My name is Muhammad, and I am completely blind. Firstly, thanks for the help on the previous topic, it really helped. Second, I'm perfectly aaware of the thunderbird groups io service for the blind. In spite of having posted there multiple times, my message is waiting for approval from the moderators, I don't know why. This issue has been bugging me for days, and I'd appreciate a solution. And when I mean solution, I don't mean things described in a visual way, such as do this and this with the mouse. If there are any visually impaired users that use jaws or NVDA here, I'd really appreciate it if you can help. Okay, now onto my problem. The problem is copying attachments from a file that somebody sent me. Yes, I know there is the save as or save all attachments option, and the attachment extractor tool, but that's not what I'm talking about. My problem is this I open the email. I go to the toggle button and press it with the enter key. There the list of attachments shows. Rather than having to click save as and brows for the folder I want, I want to be able to copy the attachment to the clipboard and then paste it into the folder of my choosing as it is sometimes more efficient than having to brows, especially if you need to paste 5 different attachments in five different folders. I know outlook can do this. So I have two files in the attachments list from the test message I sent myself. I press control c to copy and paste into the folder. Though it copies the last attachment file, I can't copy the first file. So the first file I have is a siron sound effect, and the second is a song. The song file, which is the last, it is pasted into the folder I want. However, when I arrow to the first file, which my talking program can read, it reads the file. But when I press control c to copy it to the clipboard, it doesn't copy for some reason. What can I do to get around this issue? Is there an addon that can help? Also, please give keyboard only solutions. If there isn't an addon that can fix this, would someone kindly make an addon for this for the benefit of everybody else? I know outlook has this feature so I thought it would be good if thunderbird also has it. Best regards, Muhammad.
creator: muhammed3198

title: Can the "new message" indicator be removed without CSS?
content:
In Thunderbird from v102 (I think) onwards, a new message is indicated by a yellow/orange diamond indicator to the left of the subject heading.

Unlike other "status flag" elements in the message list ("Read status", "Starred", "Priority" and so on) â which are columns that can be repositioned or removed like any other column â this indicator seems to be implemented as an integral part of the "Subject" column, and the user can't do anything in the UI to remove it.

(You can see from the HTML in the screenshot that it uses a placeholder img element inside the table cell that contains the subject line: the default CSS renders this img with the yellow/orange graphic.)

I could get rid of this indicator easily enough with some code in userChrome.css. However, that's not consistent with "Read status", "Starred", "Priority" etc, which a user can simply remove with the column chooser in the UI.

Am I missing something: is there a way of removing this "new message" indicator without custom CSS?
creator: pg_78

creator: jayaelaiya

title: User Manual/Documentation
content: Doing a search for 'Thunderbird User Manual' gets some 400+ hits, only one of which involves documentation. That one hit, a request for purchasing help for a bound user manual, has a response that "Being a free product, there is no nicely-written, bound, reference manual...We're very proud of what we do and of the documentation available." Linux, another free product, is documented in numerous "nicely-written, bound, reference manual[s]", as are most free software products. The string-search approach used here for help sometimes does not work well, and can often yield incorrect answers applying to other/older versions of the software. I am surprised at the response from a 'Top 10 Contributor' and not at all clear on the reason for the vehemence of the response. Browsers and email clients would seem to be the applications most likely to be used by the naive user, whom I would think we should encourage to seek and use documentation. As a software engineer, I certainly understand the preference for writing code over writing documentation, but also recognize the importance of well-maintained documentation. Is there something I am missing here? To my mind, the absence of coherent, date/version specific documentation is perhaps the greatest weakness in this product.
creator: dumpsterdan
